titleStmt.title: Receipt issued by the defensor of Antaeopolis

msContents.summary: Receipt issued by the defensor of Antaeopolis, Fl. Paulus, to the protocometae of kome Aphrodito for payment of 2 solidi minus 4 carats

msItem.note: 6 lines against the fibers; traces of 1 line visible (but not legible) along the fibers on the back
German translation on p. 142 of ed.pr.
Belongs to Dioscorus archive; involves same Paulus as P.Ross.Georg. III 35; cf. P.Cair. Masp. II 67254 and III 67329.

provenance.p: From the collection of N. Likhachov; once housed in the Paleographical Museum of the Academy of Science in St. Petersburg; now in the Hermitage Museum

div.ab: Flavius Paulus, defensor of the citizens of Antaeopolis, to the most admirable protocometae of the village of Aphrodite. I have received from you and been paid in full from the synetheiai which are being given to me in accordance with custom, on account of your village, two gold solidi minus 4 carats by the goldsmith's standard for the canon of the 2nd indiction. And as surety I have given you this receipt as set out above. Flavius Paulus the aforementioned defensor: the receipt is agreeable to me, as set out above.
